intro: Matisia floccosa, commonly known as the woolly matisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lecythidaceae and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a dense, woolly pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, followed by large, woody fruits that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
